body_html: I am also running on arch with pytorch 0.3.1/cudnn 7.1, and ran into this issue. I don't mind compiling from source, but haven't updated my code for 0.4. Is it possible to build a version from some point/commit in master which is 0.3.X compatible, but includes the fix?
body_text: I am also running on arch with pytorch 0.3.1/cudnn 7.1, and ran into this issue. I don't mind compiling from source, but haven't updated my code for 0.4. Is it possible to build a version from some point/commit in master which is 0.3.X compatible, but includes the fix?
body: I am also running on arch with pytorch 0.3.1/cudnn 7.1, and ran into this issue. I don't mind compiling from source, but haven't updated my code for 0.4. Is it possible to build a version from some point/commit in master which is 0.3.X compatible, but includes the fix?
